intro: Andromeda multiflora, commonly known as the sweet azalea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes other well-known genera such as Rhododendron and Pieris. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of showy, pink to white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Andromeda multiflora is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in woodland environments.
